meanings.definition: Enjoying the company of others; friendly and outgoing.
meanings.sent1: She is a sociable person who always enjoys chatting with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The new student quickly made friends because of her sociable nature.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the sociable host made sure everyone felt welcome.
meanings.sent4: Her sociable demeanor lit up the room like a warm, inviting glow.
meanings.sent5: Being sociable is like having a pocketful of sunshine wherever you go.

meanings.definition: Inclined to seek or enjoy the company of others.
meanings.sent1: He is a sociable individual who always looks forward to group activities.
meanings.sent2: The sociable puppy wagged its tail happily when surrounded by people.
meanings.sent3: The sociable cat surprised everyone by joining the group for a nap.
meanings.sent4: His sociable nature was like a magnet drawing people towards him.
meanings.sent5: The sociable bird chirped cheerfully as it flew from tree to tree.

meanings.definition: Involving or promoting friendly relations or social interaction.
meanings.sent1: The sociable event brought together people from all walks of life.
meanings.sent2: The sociable gathering was filled with laughter and shared stories.
meanings.sent3: The sociable game night turned into a hilarious competition.
meanings.sent4: The sociable atmosphere of the cafe made it a favorite spot for locals.
meanings.sent5: The sociable city welcomed visitors with open arms and warm smiles.
